required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Clinical Trial for 'Shen Qu Xiao Shi' Oral Liquid in the Treatments of Children's Functional Dyspepsia
clinical_study.official_title: Comparison of Shenqu Xiaoshi Oral Liquid and Domperidone Suspension in the Treatment of Functional Dyspepsia in Children: a Randomized, Double-blind, Double-simulated, Multi-center Clinical Study

brief_summary.textblock: With domperidone suspension as the control, the effect of shenqu xiaoshi oral liquid on functional dyspepsia in children was evaluated objectively through multi-center, randomized, double-blind and double-simulation experiment, which alleviated the clinical symptoms, restored and promoted the normal growth and development of children.

study_design_info.masking: Quadruple (Participant, Care Provider, Investigator, Outcomes Assessor)

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Two weeks after stopping the medication
Treatment for one/two week(s) and two weeks after stopping the medication
secondary_outcome.description: Food intake was measured by a scale filling by subjects or their parents. Scores range from 0 to 3. Higher score represents greater reduction in food intake and 0 means unchanged.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Treatment for one/two week(s) and two weeks after stopping the medication
Treatment for one/two week(s) and two weeks after stopping the medication

facility.name: Shanghai Jiaotong University School of Medicine Ruijin Hospital
